modules.description: This module provides functions to apply and manipulate terminal color codes in strings. It works with basic string types and uses predefined color mappings to generate colored output. Functions like `paint_as_red` and `paint_as_cyan` wrap strings in ANSI color codes, while `append_reset` adds a reset sequence to ensure proper color termination.

This module retrieves the current version of ocamlformat and provides the default configuration used by the tool. It allows dumping the default configuration to a file, enabling users to inspect or customize formatting rules. Use cases include setting up configuration files for code formatting and verifying the version of ocamlformat in use.

This module combines utilities for generating colored terminal output and retrieving ocamlformat configuration and version information. It supports string manipulation with ANSI color codes through functions like `paint_as_red` and `append_reset`, and exposes operations to dump and inspect the default ocamlformat configuration. Users can highlight text in specific colors, ensure proper color reset, and generate configuration files based on the current version's defaults. Example uses include formatting diagnostic messages with color and exporting a baseline configuration for customization.
